body: you have not been looking. the NRA and GOA as well as many conservative news sources have been fighting and reporting on them. The only one that has any traction is the UBC bill right now and its likely DOA in the Senate needing 60 votes. Its unenforceable even if it does pass

body: NRA-ILA has been reporting on it diligently like always. If you expect the mainstream anything to pick it up for social media to not filter out the warning you're barking up the wrong tree. Call your representatives, then call them again.

author.bio: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.
author.bio_html: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.

body:
It's not being talked about much because it won't become law.

Jackson Lee introduced it last year and it died in subcommittee. This year, she introduced it again, and it doesn't have any cosponsors, meaning it will die in subcommittee again.
body_html:
It's not being talked about much because it won't become law.

Jackson Lee introduced it last year and it died in subcommittee. This year, she introduced it again, and it doesn't have any cosponsors, meaning it will die in subcommittee again.

body:
Let them pass it. Let them expose themselves.  Force people to react. Too many sitting on the sidelines thinking everything is fine so long as they have their guns. Many states all of a sudden are allowing constitutional carry. Is this a good grass-roots thing or a set-up?

Get prepared to fight, be on guard,  and look for golden opportunities.  The little rats won't stay behind their fences forever.
body_html:
Let them pass it. Let them expose themselves. Force people to react. Too many sitting on the sidelines thinking everything is fine so long as they have their guns. Many states all of a sudden are allowing constitutional carry. Is this a good grass-roots thing or a set-up?

Get prepared to fight, be on guard, and look for golden opportunities. The little rats won't stay behind their fences forever.

post.title: Why is nobody on the right talking about the gun prohibitions being passed?

body: Honestly, this stuff isn't going to "make the news" until it gets passed or fails. If there were breaking headlines every time garbage was getting chewed up in congress, that's literally all you would see. I have to explain this to my boomer parents every time they watch some alarming Youtube video where some neckbeard starts spitting about "YER RIGHTS AS AN AMERICAN ARE BEING IMPINGINATED." This is why we need civics.
body_html: Honestly, this stuff isn't going to "make the news" until it gets passed or fails. If there were breaking headlines every time garbage was getting chewed up in congress, that's literally all you would see. I have to explain this to my boomer parents every time they watch some alarming Youtube video where some neckbeard starts spitting about "YER RIGHTS AS AN AMERICAN ARE BEING IMPINGINATED." This is why we need civics.

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: Because they no longer care. In the past year conservatives have seen a frighteningly sudden shift from almost-libertarians to authrightism and fascism, some even advocating a return to monarchy. Free speech, gun rights, free markets, rights, and "rugged individualism"as it's called are no longer important to them. Their current mission is to establish strict law and order and enforce "traditional values", especially in the area of families and gender roles. This fluke mirrors a similar incident when the formerly libertarian millennials went ballistic and somehow completely reversed their politics, becoming radical leftist SJWs, communists, and PC-police. I have no idea how either of these happened or how it's even possible. But it shows you just how untrustworthy and unpredictable people are. And now we have two main platforms which are indistinguishable in every area except for which side of a few debates they're on.
body_html: Because they no longer care. In the past year conservatives have seen a frighteningly sudden shift from almost-libertarians to authrightism and fascism, some even advocating a return to monarchy. Free speech, gun rights, free markets, rights, and "rugged individualism"as it's called are no longer important to them. Their current mission is to establish strict law and order and enforce "traditional values", especially in the area of families and gender roles. This fluke mirrors a similar incident when the formerly libertarian millennials went ballistic and somehow completely reversed their politics, becoming radical leftist SJWs, communists, and PC-police. I have no idea how either of these happened or how it's even possible. But it shows you just how untrustworthy and unpredictable people are. And now we have two main platforms which are indistinguishable in every area except for which side of a few debates they're on.

body:
Most conservatives just want to be left the fuck alone and enjoy basic freedoms without a massive tyrannical corrupt government shitting on us 24/7 and woke authoritarians in league with massive corporations telling us what we can and cant say or do. Oh and not be demonized all day as Nazis for thinking that. The vast majority of conservatives are live and let live, unfortunately that doesn't measure up against bloodthirsty ruthless leftism that seeks power at all costs. 

I don't know any authoritarian conservatives, and the fascist/ethnonationalist/monarchist factions are a total fringe minority bloated up as a Boogeyman so they can call 50% of the country domestic extremists
body_html:
Most conservatives just want to be left the fuck alone and enjoy basic freedoms without a massive tyrannical corrupt government shitting on us 24/7 and woke authoritarians in league with massive corporations telling us what we can and cant say or do. Oh and not be demonized all day as Nazis for thinking that. The vast majority of conservatives are live and let live, unfortunately that doesn't measure up against bloodthirsty ruthless leftism that seeks power at all costs.

I don't know any authoritarian conservatives, and the fascist/ethnonationalist/monarchist factions are a total fringe minority bloated up as a Boogeyman so they can call 50% of the country domestic extremists

author.bio_html:

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: You're one of the ones who they left behind then. I've watched my family and friends change. I've seen the shift in thinking on right wing media. The overall "conservative" movement is no longer live and let live. It's no longer "conserve our freedoms", it's become "conserve our traditions". I find a lot of common ground with your type, and that used to be the entire platform. But no longer. It's all "crack down on these people destroying society and tradition" now. I think the rioting this summer made them become wary of anyone who belongs to one of the "minority groups" the left always talks about. Whereas before they firmly didn't care, now they come to associate them with recklessness and chaos, and the enemy. And it's the left's fault for portraying them that way in the first place.

The overall "conservative" movement is no longer live and let live. It's no longer "conserve our freedoms", it's become "conserve our traditions". post.title: Why is nobody on the right talking about the gun prohibitions being passed?

body:
These people have been completely backed into a corner, the radicalization you see isn't a coincidence. It's a complete reaction to authoritarian leftist woke cult tyrants who yes, do want to destroy their traditions, freedoms, and values and force all sorts of horrible shit on everyone. They are completely open about that. When you play hardcore identity politics for decades and divide the populace where everyone else is "allowed" to consolidate power through ethnic groups....except white people, then it should come as absolutely no surprise that a certain % of white people feel like they are under attack. When street thugs destroy small businesses and terrorize cities and neighborhoods for months, with zero consequences, with politicians and massive corporations essentially sponsoring their chaos, and corrupt DAs releasing them and special interest groups bailing them out, and YOU'RE RACIST if you aren't supporting them, conservatives feel like they are under attack.

And based on the blatant ramping up of MSM propaganda, critical race theory communist bullshit infiltrating and ruining every institution (academia, video games, movies, books, sports, !SCIENCE!, our military, etc) and technocrat censorship of anyone questioning any of these compromised institutions, they aren't wrong.  I've been saying since Trayvon Martin that all of this race nonsense is just a way to fire up the peasants against each other so they don't focus on the ruling class robbing us blind. They've put it on maximum overdrive, with a new "Fuck You America, We Spit In Your Face ("COVID Relief") Bill" every few months. 

It's sad to see, but I still refuse to believe that the majority of conservatives are now rabid ethnonationalists and racists. They are just fucking pissed off and completely awake to blatantly hostile forces attacking them from every angle with no respite, and no recourse. Everything has accelerated, expect massive attacks on the 2nd amendment to come soon - they're already brewing. The GOP is completely cucked and sold out to the same special interests and oligarchs that run everything, and there is no representation for the average "conservative" aside from Donald Trump and a few blowhard women in Congress. Everyone else is compromised and voting really doesn't mean anything anymore. At this point I don't even think of it as left vs. right, liberal vs. conservative whatever.  It's are you down with the global authoritarian woke cult? Massive government control in your life, censorship, critical race theory, America is and has always been a fundamentally racist country, gender and trans kids salad, silence is violence. Or do you reject this atrocity of ideology and seek sovereignty and freedom?  This ideology is societal weaponized AIDS and it's doing a damn good job completely destroying our civilization and making everyone hate each other for stupid fucking reasons. The constant assault coming from the left and the elites certainly will create more racists and radical ethnonationalists.

Our country is on the verge of death if it isn't dead already, and honestly the best thing that could happen is likely secession or a Balkanization of sorts before we all start killing each other. I don't think the corporate socialist technocrat tyrant overlords want any of their potential slaves to get away with anything like that though.

parent.body: You're one of the ones who they left behind then. I've watched my family and friends change. I've seen the shift in thinking on right wing media. The overall "conservative" movement is no longer live and let live. It's no longer "conserve our freedoms", it's become "conserve our traditions". I find a lot of common ground with your type, and that used to be the entire platform. But no longer. It's all "crack down on these people destroying society and tradition" now. I think the rioting this summer made them become wary of anyone who belongs to one of the "minority groups" the left always talks about. Whereas before they firmly didn't care, now they come to associate them with recklessness and chaos, and the enemy. And it's the left's fault for portraying them that way in the first place.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
The problem is they've gone from reacting to the "hate all white people" nonsense with "all lives matter" to "white people are better than black people, get white birth rates up and stop other races from having kids!". And "men are not devils" to "society collapsed when women were given any rights at all!". And I've even seen attacks on free speech if it doesn't advocate for traditionalism. This is not the American movement founded by the anti-federalists which later descended into the Republican Party we knew for so long, it is like being a Tory during the Revolution. I understand the fear and why everything feels justified during chaos, but the fear is of tyranny and they want to stop it, yet their new solution is creating their own system of tyranny? How can Satan drive out Satan? That's not going to fix a damn thing, it just makes it worse because now both parties are just as bad as the other and there's not even a lesser of the two evils anymore. If you want to make a change and oppose someone else you obviously don't go and do the exact same things they're doing, yet "conservatives" right now don't seem to understand this and they've completely abandoned everything they once stood for.

On a more minor note, I must add that Donald Trump is not a conservative, but a populist. His campaign is targeted at the interests of the people, not party principles. However it's interesting that you bring him up, because he actually proves my point. Prior to his election many conservatives feared he might be too authoritarian and untrustworthy. Now however, they're complaining that he's not anywhere near authoritarian *enough* for them, despite his auth tendencies increasing over the course of his first term. Trump hasn't been affected much by this new movement, and he shows how the same people now view him from the opposite side of the pole.

On a more minor note, I must add that Donald Trump is not a conservative, but a populist. His campaign is targeted at the interests of the people, not party principles. However it's interesting that you bring him up, because he actually proves my point. Prior to his election many conservatives feared he might be too authoritarian and untrustworthy. Now however, they're complaining that he's not anywhere near authoritarian enough for them, despite his auth tendencies increasing over the course of his first term. Trump hasn't been affected much by this new movement, and he shows how the same people now view him from the opposite side of the pole.
